medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was prenatally diagnosed with hyperoxaluria type 1 based on family history and genetic testing. After birth, the patient underwent hyperhydration by intravenous fluids and complementary breastfeeding to prevent more than 5% weight loss. Initial weight loss was 3%; fluid intake adjusted after reaching birth weight. At 3 months of age, nephrocalcinosis was detected, followed by kidney stones at 9 months. Treatment with tamsulosin resulted in stone expulsion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient's 9-year-old brother had hyperoxaluria type 1 with complications including kidney damage and nephrocalcinosis, leading to liver and kidney transplants.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's brother has a diagnosis of hyperoxaluria type 1, onset at 2 months of age.
